intro: Tiquilia brevifolia var. plicata, commonly known as the pleated tiquilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. The varietal name "plicata" refers to the pleated or folded appearance of its leaves.
